thread.title: ‘My Father’s Business’ Review: Where Every Day Is Dollar Day

author: Hendrik Meijer
title: ‘My Father’s Business’ Review: Where Every Day Is Dollar Day
text:
When Cal Turner Jr. became president of the no-frills Dollar General retail chain in 1977, its founder still cast a long shadow. Cal Turner Sr., the very picture of a seat-of-the-pants entrepreneur, broached the subject of a promotion from behind his bathroom door. “Son,” he called out, “I have decided it’s time for you to become president so I can be chairman for a long time.”
“My dad sat on the john,” Mr. Turner writes in “My Father’s Business,” conjuring one of the more memorable moments in the annals of executive succession....
